intro: Linaria cavanillesii, commonly known as the Cavanilles' toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its vibrant yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant features slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
